page.title: 09 CASTLE EDEN WALKWAY
page.content: THE NORTH EASTERN RAILWAY LINE WAS OPENED IN 1880. IT JOINED UP BOWESFIELD JUNCTION, STOCKTON, THORPE THEWELS, WYNWARD AND HURWURTH BURN WITH WELLFIELD, SUNDERLAND, CASTLE EDEN AND HART. PASSENGERS BECAME NON-EXISTANT ON THIS LINE IN 1931 AND THE SAME HAPPENED TO THE GOODS IN 1951 AND EVENTUALLY THE FINAL STOPPAGE WAS MADE TO MINERALS IN 1966. CLEVELAND COUNTY COUNCIL TOOK OVER FROM THE NORTH EASTERN RAILWAY COMPANY. IN 1979 AND THE RAILWAY'S VIADUCT WAS KNOCKED DOWN AND THE TRACK PULLED UP. IT WAS THEN TRANSFORMED INTO A NATURE TRAIL. OVER 60,000 PEOPLE VISITED THE WALKWAY IN 1983 AND EVEN MORE IN 1984. THE WALKWAY FOLLOWS THE EXACT TRACK OF THE CASTLE EDEN RAILWAY FOR 3\ MILES.
